column4: Hello friends I have some issue with mi laptop, after watching a video for a while my screen turns black, and a ctrl alt backspace doesn't even work...I have to restart my machine every time it happens...
Is there some kind of Power Saver program running?
Mine does that also, desktop. Karmic, I resolved it by setting the Power Saver settings a bit, like a tweak. But that is not the solution, it was a fast workaround.
my screen blinks a little before it goes black, my Power Saving program is configured in a way the pc never turns off the screen, not even with the battery
Looking at other box now, it has Jaunty, same animal, sorta.
do you have any idea about what could it be???...
I am thinking it is a xorg conf thing, still looking, you say it does this Hardwired also?
yeah it does it no matter if this is plugged or unplugged...
Do you have a screensaver set?
it says that's on but I've never see it work..
From the forums, that is what is doing it, or is most likely to be it, turn screen saver OFF.
OK, I'll do that....and well I'll begin to watch a movie an see what happens..
Gnome also added fading in, still looking at that,
Look at what samreeds posted here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=899195&highlight=screen+fade
Thxs a lot I'll check it and let you know...
